page.topic: Turn 'Pre-render' option on for UX Components
page.description: Bulk operation that enables 'Pre-render' option for all UX Components in the workspace.
page.discussion: If you have a large number of UX components and you want to turn on the 'Pre-render at design-time' option for each UX component, opening each component, setting the property and then saving the component would be tedious. The *[ui:Turn 'Pre-render' option on for UX Components]* bulk operation automatically set this property in one or more UX components in a project. The bulk operation enables pre-rendering in the selected UX components.

section.title: How to Perform a Turn 'Pre-render' option on for UX Components Bulk Operation

step.description: To perform a *[ui:Turn 'Pre-render' option on for UX Components]* bulk operation, open the Web Projects Control Panel and select *[ui:Bulk Operations]* > *[ui:Turn 'Pre-render' option on for UX Components...]* from the *[ui:Edit]* menu:

description.p: In the *[ui:Bulk Convert UX to Pre-render]* dialog, optionally check *[ui:Apply security and server-side show/hide expressions client-side]*. Enabling this option may make your component less secure. See [About Applying Security and Server-side Show/Hide Expressions on the Client] below.

step.important: It is important to understand the difference between applying security and sever-side show/hide expressions *[ui:server-side]* and *[ui:client-side]*.
step.note: You can choose to enable or disable *[ui:Apply security and server-side show/hide expressions client-side]* in the next step.

step.description: Select the UX Components to enable pre-rendering. Optionally enable or disable *[ui:Apply security and server-side show/hide expressions client-side]* using the checkbox at the bottom of the dialog.
Click *[ui:OK]* to apply the bulk operation.

Alpha Anywhere may prompt you to adjust other settings in a UX Component when pre-render is enabled, such as change the error reporting style. You may optionally change the setting described in the prompt when the dialog is shown. Click *[ui:OK]* to continue with the bulk operation.
step.note: You may see other prompts not shown here.

figure.title: Using an Error Style Not Recommended for Use in Container Width Layout Mode Prompt

step.description: A notice will be shown when the bulk operation completes. Click *[ui:OK]* to close the notice.

section.title: About Applying Security and Server-side Show/Hide Expressions on the Client
section.important: It is important to understand the difference between applying security and sever-side show/hide expressions *[ui:server-side]* and *[ui:client-side]*.

description.p: When applied *[ui:server-side]*, the controls that should not be visible to the user are *[physically removed]* from the HTML that is sent to the client.

On the other hand, when applied *[ui:client-side]*, the computation about which controls should be hidden is still done *[ui:server-side]*, but the controls that should be hidden *[are still physically in the HTML]* and are *[hidden]* when the component is rendered. Therefore, *[ui:client-side]* option is *[less secure]* because a user might view the source on the page and see the data for the controls that have been hidden.

section.note: A UX component will not be converted to use the *[ui:pre-render]* option if it has security or server-side show/hide expressions and *[ui:Apply security and server-side show/hide expressions client-side]* is not enabled.
